title: Motivation-Centered Task Design Strategies for Mathematics and Physics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Program for Pre-Service/In-Service Teachers to Strengthen Actual Class Design Competencies. Facilitates Collaborative and Self-Directed Learning Environments Using Personal Learning Devices

learning_goals: Learners can analyze motivation elements based on Self-Determination Theory (SDT) and design math/physics tasks.

Learners develop project assignments on real-life topics (e.g., energy saving, recycling design) over four weeks and receive confirmation from peer/teacher evaluations that they effectively utilized three or more engagement strategies (gamification elements, real-life applications).

Learners use a provided checklist (five motivation elements: challenge, relevance, feedback, autonomy, collaboration) during peer reviews to analyze three peer assignments and write evaluation reports with at least two improvement suggestions per assignment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
